p: The activity of BC extracts in terms of their genotoxicity was expressed in two points of views. Table 6 states, whether BC extracts presents genotoxic activity for human lymphocytes and Table 7 points out antigenotoxic activity results for BC extracts, which states the activity of the BC extract to inhibit the genotoxic activity of H 2O 2. According to Table 6, while 500 µg.mL −1 of BC extract caused no tail DNA damage, 1000 µg.mL −1 of BC extract presented only 0.05% of tail DNA damage, where positive control was the cause of 54% of tail DNA damage. On the other hand, according to Table 7, 500 µg.mL −1 and 1000 µg.mL −1 of BC extract inhibited the genotoxic activity of 50 µM H 2O 2 as 39% and 55% respectively. Also, BC extract presented ~ 30% decrease in tail length for 500 µg.mL −1 of the extract and ~ 45% decrease in tail length for 1000 µg.mL −1 ( Fig. 2).
